column4: a linux newbie here, i installed kubuntu a few days ago and i did an upgrade, but now everytime i try to login in my KDE enviroment it returns me to the login. i already downgraded the xorg server from 10.4 to 10(cd version) but no cigar. Ideas anyone? btw i cant use my ethernet in commandline mode.. it worked in the graphical enviroment.
That's pretty bizarre.  Have you tried reinstalling?
(sorry to suggest such a spartan tactic)
prefer not to, i'm happy itsa dual boot now... had some bad experiances with grub in the past ;)
Can you login from the command prompt?  At the login window, use Ctrl + Alt + F1 to drop beneath Xorg, and login.
yes i can, but my ethernet card doesnt work then, so i cant apt-get etc.. i downgraded the xorg server to teh on eon the install cd (version 10.. compared to 10.4 that was upgraded)
That's strange.  Your ethernet card should function without Xorg.
it all works,works finw when booted in wondows, and it worked in ubuntu
But your internet just doesn't work until Xorg is booted, huh?  That's awfully strange.  And you still have this Kubuntu problem.  Hmmm...
yeah thats what i though, ping says it cant resolve, and ifconfig doesnt staat my ip
What is the exact behavior of your Kubuntu login?  What happens from when you hit "Enter" on the password dialogue?
black screen, some gitter, blackscreen, and then back to the login
Use Ctrl + Alt + F1 to drop into terminal and take a look at the output of "dmesg"
You can drop back into Xorg with Ctrl + Alt + F7.
Are you familiar with pipes and the grep command?
OK.  You may want to try grepping for KDE, Xorg, etc.
ok will do(switch to pm maybe?)
